articles.description: Follow live text updates from day two of the fifth Test between India and England in Dharamsala.
articles.title: India resume on 135-1, just 83 behind England on day two

articles.description: Reaction to Thursday's Europa League and Conference League games, plus build-up to this weekend's Premier League action.
articles.title: Europa League & Conference League reaction, plus Premier League build-up

articles.description: Darwin Nunez has "quality coming out of his ears", says Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp after the player warmed up for Manchester City with two more goals.
articles.title: 'Quality coming out of his ears' - Klopp hails Nunez

articles.description: As Francis Ngannou aims to derail Anthony Joshua's plans of recapturing a world title, BBC Sport asks the boxing world for their predictions.
articles.title: Anthony Joshua v Francis Ngannou: Predictions from the world of boxing

articles.description: In his latest BBC Sport column, Ireland hooker Rob Herring - currently out injured - discusses the aura of Twickenham and the threats England pose to the Six Nations champions on Saturday.
articles.title: 'England at Twickenham always a huge test for Ireland'

articles.description: After a thrilling 2-2 draw away to Benfica, BBC Scotland examines if Rangers are now favourites to make the quarter-finals of the Europa League given their strong home record.
articles.title: Does Ibrox factor give Rangers edge over Benfica?

articles.description: In 2019, Great Britain's women's sprinters made a pact "to be a force". Five years on, they are enjoying success across all the sprinting disciplines with the Paris Olympics just around the corner.
articles.title: British Cycling: How Great Britain's women's sprinters became a force on the track

articles.description: Aston Martin's Fernando Alonso sets the pace from George Russell and Max Verstappen in Saudi Arabian Grand Prix second practice.
articles.title: Saudi Arabian Grand Prix: Fernando Alonso fastest in second practice ahead of George Russell

articles.description: Zambia forward Barbra Banda joins Orlando Pride for £581,000 - the second-most expensive women's transfer in history.
articles.title: Pride sign Banda in second-biggest women's transfer

articles.description: Boxer Cindy Ngamba tells BBC Sport about her journey from Cameroon to England and the challenges she has faced in trying to earn a spot at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
articles.title: Paris Olympics: Cindy Ngamba on fighting for British citizenship and her dream of competing at the Games
